alert.note: Alert for Gilchrist; Southern Columbia; Suwannee (Florida) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Jacksonville (Northeast Florida and Southeast Georgia)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 11 at 5:57PM EDT by NWS Jacksonville
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northern Gilchrist, southwestern Columbia and southeastern Suwannee Counties through 645 PM EDT... At 557 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Fort White, or 8 miles south of Ichetucknee Spring, moving northwest at 10 mph. HAZARD...Winds around 40 mph and nickel size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Bell, Ichetucknee Spring, Fort White, Branford and Hildreth. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.88 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
